name: regather
content:
regather verb
(come together)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I ] When people or animals regather, they come together in a group for a second, third, etc. time: The audience regathered for the final hour. At night we re-gather for a walking tour of the evening market.
More examplesFewer examplesThe team re-gathered for a sensational final assault.After the staff members had regathered, the meeting took place.After being dispersed, the remaining demonstrators were regathering at a local university building.

regather verb
(collect)
[ T ] to collect several things, often from different places or people, for a second, third, etc. time: She lost her grip on the sticks along the way and had to regather the bundle. The shepherds went up into the mountains to re-gather the sheep.
More examplesFewer examplesRegather everything onto your desk and then begin to process everything.

regather your strength
to prepare to make a great effort again to be strong: The soldiers planned to regather their strength in hiding places in the village as they waited for orders from their commander.
